text: Peder Alsvik (26 June 1882 - 31 December 1964) was a Norwegian politician for the Labour Party. He was born in Aure. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Møre og Romsdal in 1937, and was re-elected on two occasions. He had previously served in the position of deputy representative during the terms 1931-1933 and 1934-1936\. On the local level Alsvik was a member of Bremsnes municipality council from 1916 to 1919 and 1925 to 1934. ==References== * Category:1882 births Category:1964 deaths Category:Members of the Storting Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Møre og Romsdal politicians Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Peder Alsvik
